In "Star Wars" many of the buildings constructed to be used in shots of Tatooine are still standing in Tunisia. In fact, some of them are still used by locals. In "Star Wars" the Jawa language is based on a sped-up version of the Zulu language. Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones was labelled as “Cue Ball” when it shipped to theaters. The cow-like creature seen grazing in the fields behind Anakin and Padmé in Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones can be seen again as an asteroid later in the film. Star Wars: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith was labelled as “The Bridge” when it shipped to theaters.
The Hunger Games is currently the third-most highlighted Kindle book of all time. The Bible is first. The first Hunger Games movie was banned in Vietnam. The Hunger Games has been translated in 51 different languages.
In "Jurassic Park" in order to create the ripple effect in the glass of water, a guitar string was attached to the underside of the dashboard of the jeep and strung. In "Jurassic Park" the screams in this scene are genuine — the animatronic T. rex was not supposed to break the plexiglass. The "Jurassic Park" has a running time of 127 minutes — but includes only 15 minutes of actual dinosaur footage. In "Jurassic Park" Harrison Ford turned down the role of Dr. Alan Grant.
